articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah officials are no longer demanding a truce in Gaza as a condition for reaching a ceasefire in Lebanon, rowing back from an oft-repeated promise to keep fighting until Israel halts its offensive against Hezbollah's Iran-backed ally Hamas.
articles.title: Hezbollah officials drop Gaza truce as condition for Lebanon ceasefire

articles.author: Joseph Tanfani, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Pro-Trump officials' rise to prominence on local election boards raises the chances that they will be able to delay or sow doubt over the election, if Trump loses.
articles.title: Election officials who back Trump’s “Big Lie” stir concern in swing states

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier passed the first test of his new government on Tuesday, as a leftist no-confidence motion failed to garner enough votes to bring down his center-right administration.
articles.title: Left-wing's no-confidence motion against French government fails

articles.author: Cassandra Garrison
articles.description: The mayor of Chilpancingo, the capital of Mexico's violence-plagued state of Guerrero, traveled alone to an out-of-town meeting before he was killed, Mexico's security minister said on Tuesday about a murder which has shocked the country.
articles.title: Mexican local mayor went alone to meeting before his brutal killing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Colombia's National Electoral Council (CNE) on Tuesday requested an investigation into the 2022 election campaign of President Gustavo Petro over alleged violation of financing limits, it said in a statement.
articles.title: Colombia electoral authority requests investigation into Petro campaign financing

articles.author: George Obulutsa, Ammu Kannampilly
articles.description: Kenya's parliament voted on Tuesday to impeach Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua on charges including enriching himself and stirring ethnic hatred, the chamber's speaker said, paving the way for the senate to consider the motion.
articles.title: Kenya lawmakers impeach deputy president, paving way for senate vote

articles.author: Gabriela Selser
articles.description: The European Union on Tuesday extended sanctions for another year against 21 Nicaraguan officials, including Rosario Murillo, vice president and wife of President Daniel Ortega, as well as three of their children.
articles.title: EU extends sanctions on Nicaraguan officials

articles.author: Steven Scheer, Yomna Ehab
articles.description: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's third-largest city of Haifa, police said early on Monday, and Israeli media reported 10 injured in the country's north on the first anniversary of the Gaza war, which has spread in the Middle East.
articles.title: Hezbollah strikes Israel on Gaza war anniversary; fears grow over Middle East instability

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday that Ukraine needed to secure and deploy advanced missiles and to achieve faster results with them on the battlefield.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy wants missiles, faster results on battlefield

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Tampa, Florida, metropolitan area, home to around 3.1 million people, is in the direct path of a major hurricane, Milton, for the first time in over a century and vulnerable to flooding.
articles.title: Tampa in path of hurricane for first time in a century
